snippet: A 2011 ruling held that the N.S.A. had violated the Constitution for several years by gathering tens of thousands of domestic communications unrelated to terrorism.
abstract: Secret ruling made public shows that federal Judge John D Bates sharply rebuked National Security Agency in 2011 for repeatedly misleading court that overseas its surveillance on domestic soil; judge ruled that NSA had violated the Constitution for several years by gathering tens of thousands of domestic communications unrelated to terrorism.

byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and SCOTT SHANE

lead_paragraph: A 2011 ruling held that the N.S.A. had violated the Constitution for several years by gathering tens of thousands of domestic communications unrelated to terrorism.

headline.main: Secret Court Rebuked N.S.A. on Surveillance
headline.print_headline: Top-Secret Court Castigated N.S.A. On Surveillance
